answers.answer: Would be very risky. Baby would be at risk for alot of health issues. But if u want a baby go for it
The chances of a pregnancy happening naturally at 45 are pretty low. Talk to your Dr about your options.

I am 39 I got pregnant unintentionally after getting into really good shape and losing 50 lbs. I started taking vitamins like Women's One a day, a b comlex and a protien shake meal replacement (Isopure). Within a month of my weight stabalizing, I became pregnant. Mind you I have a history of PECOS, Diabetes, and generally questionable health. I say all of this to say, I believe odds increase the healthier are and more balanced with vitamins. I would engage your ob immediately pre pregnancy to walk through family history, medical challenges, expectations, and risk. I am not sure the age of your partner,  but there seems to be some addional risks to consider and baby impact with the age of dad. Look at the whole picture and make your decision on what is best for you.

The older you get, the higher the risk for health issues. For both you and baby. My mom had me at 19, I'm perfectly healthy. She had my brother at 25, he's perfectly healthy. My mom got pregnant at 38 unintentionally thinking she could no longer get pregnant. She had my little sister at 39 and she has autism, sensory issues, and has had a hard time growing physically at a normal pace. Talk to your doctor and see what they recommend because all women are different.
As long as ur healthy then its fine. My mother's friends was 43 when she got pregnant with her 4th child. He is perfectly healthy with no issues. Now in his 20's.

I am a 44 yr old mother of 3 girls 22 20 and 18... 1 boy 12 .... A grandma of 2 almost 3 lol... I thought I had food poisoning for 3 days ... Took home preg ... The.first day I missed my period ... Boy was wrong ... I was in shock ...I have been blessed again !!! I love my life ... I found an ob... Before my first appointment I had a bad hemorrhage 911 the whole deal I was petrified thought I lost my little booger... At 8 weeks saw my doctor was still bleeding Alittle but ultrasound looked fine baby looked great ... Placenta had torn away from uterus ... At 10 weeks I had the harmony test ... Doctor said because of my age I was high risk ... For downs ... Trisomy 21 .... The test came back a week later ... She called me in for an early appointment ... I was so excited because the harmony test is ... My blood taken ... And babies DNA extracted from my blood ... I was going to find out the sex .... She explained my results ... DNA showed the xtra chromosome... Trisomy 21 ... She said my baby has downs ... I cried ... Was drepressed ...prayed ... And have done way to much googling.... Knowing in heart I do not believe in termination ....I have come to realise after a lot of praying ... Not only have I been blessed to have a beautiful little girl .... God has blessed me with an even more special gift ... I can not wait to hold her ... To see her... To love her ... I feel so priveledged and so excited that god thinks I am special enough to bless me yet again to love this special little girl downs or not ... I'm 15 weeks now .... I hope I have not offened anyone with my opinions ... 400,000 Americans have downs ... 92 percent of women who find out they are having a downs baby abort ... It's hard to believe ... Or Understand .... But I know we all have a choice .... I'm choosing love my baby No Matter What !!!

@gamma...beautifully put!!! I'm pregnant with #3 and although only 34, I am very high risk for a number of reasons, but decided not to get the tests done because my mom had an unplanned pregnancy 10yrs after having me (and I was youngest of 3). My little brother has down syndrome and I absolutely adore him!!! I didn't want to know because it's added stress during the pregnancy based on possibility....I love my baby no matter how he arrives!!@brown...if you want a baby, I agree with the other ladies to involve your dr right away and go for it! If it's meant to be, it'll happen!!

I'm naturally pregnant by accident at 46 (thought I was in menopause).  We had all the testing and our little boy is ok, no genetic issues, very healthy.  We are very aware however that we are in a very very small percentage of people our age who are this "lucky"  (I would venture to say that gamma mikey is lucky too, because she has a viable pregnancy which is frankly the biggest hurdle at our age :).  That said, it does happen that everything is ok.  I'm healthier in this pregnancy than the other three as well, just crazy tired constantly lol!  No diabetes, no hypertension, slightly higher than normal weight gain at this point (31 pounds), but I'm not caring too much about that I am 30 weeks and in one more week delivery of a healthy baby is the most likely scenario.  I am hoping to carry 9 of the next ten though because lolol  I want the summer off of work!  Good luck to you!  I highly suggest you ONLY try this if you get good doctors involved early on, have genetic testing of both you and your partner in advance (Down's is the least serious of the problems you could be facing!) and are close enough to go to an OBGYN that specializes in "elderly pregnancy" (yes that's what they call us, I have medical paperwork that uses that term) and Maternal Fetal Care Clinic in your area that is capable of high level fetal genetic testing and care.

question: What do you recommend on getting pregnant at 45
title: pregnancy
